para.caption: php.ini requirements
para.text:
It's worth changing the following values in php.ini:
Unix: include_path = ".:/path/to/where/lang.base.php/resides"
Windows: include_path = ".;c:\path\to\where\lang.base.php\resides"
Instead of: require('/path/to/where/lang.base.php/resides/lang.base.php'); you can write require('lang.base.php'); and be calm when porting your code to another machine.
See also PHP: Configuration, Examples 3-1 and 3-2.
For certain parts of the framework to work properly, please set all magic quotes related settings to Off:
magic_quotes_gpc = Off magic_quotes_runtime = Off magic_quotes_sybase = Off

para.caption: Minimum requirements
para.text: PHP should be available in an up-to-date version, anything above version 4.3.0 should work. Older versions do not support e.g. the new superglobal variables $_*, do now know the array(&$this, 'method') notation for call_user_func[_array]() or have problems with "parent" (see PHP Bug #12313). The latest change incorporates debug_backtrace to supply even more detailled exception information, thus requiring at least PHP 4.3.0.

para.caption: Needed files
para.text:
To get a working XP framework, the following files in the following directories are required:
In the base directory (eg. /usr/local/lib/skeleton/):
lang.base.php
In the directory "lang" (e.g. /usr/local/lib/skeleton/lang):
Object.class.php
Exception.class.php
XPClass.class.php
Exception.class.php
IllegalAccessException.class.php
IllegalArgumentException.class.php
IllegalStateException.class.php
FormatException.class.php
ClassLoader.class.php
(As a rough rule: you need all the files directly in skeleton/lang, and lang.base.php).

para.caption: Needed directories (hier)
para.text:
Some projects/ports might require a special filesystem setup, for logfiles and runtime information storage. Currently, we list these directories as required:
/var/log/xp
here go logfiles
/var/run/xp
here go runtime files
Note: small scripts/programs usually do not require these directories, but projects do.
